Reconciling Items

The View Comparison utility allows reconciliation, an automated process for sharing, deleting, and merging the folders or items displayed in the item pane. All of these processes can be performed manually, but the reconciliation process can save you time if all of the selected items with the same icon are to be treated identically.

To reconcile child folders or items:

  1. Open the view to be used as the source.

  2. Click View > Compare/Merge to select the view that will serve as the target.

  3. Select the appropriate tab from the lower pane of the View Comparison window.

  4. Select one or more items from the item pane. At least one of these items must be different from the others.

  5. Do one of the following:

    • Select Reconcile > Source View from the Item or context menu, or click the Reconcile Source button.

    • Select the Reconcile > Target View from the Item or context menu, or click the Reconcile Target button on the toolbar.

    The Reconcile dialog opens.

  6. Indicate what should be done with the selected items found only in the source view. From the For items only in source view group box, select the Do nothing, Share items to target view, or Delete items from source view option button.

    7. Note: In the For items only in source view and For items only in target view group boxes, one of the options will be disabled, depending upon the type of merge you are doing. For example, if you are merging to the source view, items that are only in the source cannot be shared to the target view. Therefore the Share items to target view option button is disabled.

  7. Indicate what should be done with the selected items found only in the target view. From the For items only in target view group box, select the Do nothing, Share items to source view, or Delete items from target view option button.

  8. Indicate what should be done with the selected items that exist in both views but are different. From the For items needing merge group box, select the Do nothing, Merge Items, or Auto-merge Items option button.

  9. Click OK. Depending on your selections, various In Progress dialogs open to show progress.

  10. If you have selected the Auto-merge Items option button, the Merge Options dialog opens.

    1. (Files only) Select or clear the Merge item properties and Merge item contents check boxes, depending on your requirements.

    2. (Files only) Do one of the following:

        • Select the Save merged item contents to server check box to check the file in as part of the merge process.

        • Clear the Save merged item contents to server check box to save the merged contents in the working folder for the Merge To location. This allows you to test the merged file before checking it in manually. Note: Your most recent setting for the Save merged item contents to server check box becomes a personal option and is stored in starteam-client-options.xml.

    3. Select the Record successful merge check box to store information needed to track merge operations.

    4. Select the Use last recorded merge check box to base the merge on the two items being merged and the Merge From item used for the last recorded merge. Otherwise, the most recent common ancestor will be used to perform a three-way merge. The common ancestor is a historical revision that has the same revision number in both views.

    5. Click OK.

  11. If you selected the Merge Items or Auto-Merge Items option button, the Merge in Progress dialog opens and is interrupted by the other dialogs that the application uses during these processes.
